meanings.definition: A long passage in a building, with doors leading to rooms on either side.
meanings.sent1: The school corridor was filled with students rushing to their next class.
meanings.sent2: I walked down the hospital corridor to visit my friend in room 203.
meanings.sent3: The corridor was so long that I pretended to be a race car zooming through it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a corridor of memories, each door leading to a different moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house corridor was dimly lit, with shadows lurking in every corner.
